title.narrative: F.a: Labour education programme for electricity and public sector workers

description.narrative: The project will found a trade union training programme (Escuela Nacional Sindical de Ecuador, ENSe) that will give relevant training on political, economic, legislative and labour issues for the trade union movement in Ecuador. In addition, a new trade un ion research programme will produce background and statistical information to strengthen the training. The lack of a systematic and independent trade union training and research has led to the inability of the trade union movement to renew itself and give opportunities for a new generation of leaders. Hence the trade union movement remains very scattered, weak and unable to fight the challenges in working life. The long term impact of the project should be a new generation of trade union leaders and activis ts where especially young and women are well represented. As a result of the training and research programme the trade union movement will strengthen and be better equipped to improve the working conditions of workers. A direct result of the project will b e the trade union training programme that has good quality courses that meet the needs of trade union movement. The project will train 20 trainers (20% women) and 2000 activists (10% women). The new research programme will produce quality research, train f our researchers and complete four labour related studies within the project period.The main beneficiaries of the project are the Electrical Workers Union, the Coalition of Electrical Worker Unions ENLACE and the Confederation of Public Sector CTSPE as well as their members and potential members. The aim is that also other organized and unorganized electrical sector workers from private and public sector will join the training as well as public sector workers from different state entities. The project will b e implemented by the Electrical Workers Union (Comite de empresa de los trabajadores de la Empresa Electrica de Quito). The Electrical Workers Union is a strong national actor that has had a long term dream to establish a trade union training programme usi ng the examples of other trade union schools in Latin America (like Colombia, Uruguay and Brazil).
